thread.title: 'Hidden Figures,' 'La La Land' Among Location Managers Guild Award Nominees
thread.title_full: 'Hidden Figures,' 'La La Land' Among Location Managers Guild Award Nominees

title: 'Hidden Figures,' 'La La Land' Among Location Managers Guild Award Nominees
text:
Sign up for our Newsletters . Daily Edition 'Hidden Figures,''La La Land' Among Location Managers Guild Award Nominees 9:27 AM 2/22/2017 TV contenders include 'The Crown' and 'Westworld.' Courtesy of Lionsgate 
The nominees have been unveiled for the Location Managers Guild International's 4th annual Awards, which will be handed out April 8 at the Steven J. Ross Theater at Warner Bros. Studios. 
Nominees for a period feature are the location managers of Hacksaw Ridge, Hail, Caesar!, Hidden Figures, Live By Night and Rogue One: A Star Wars Story. Nominees for a contemporary film are Hell Or High Water, Jason Bourne, La La Land, Lion and Manchester by the Sea. 
In the TV categories, the location managers of The Crown, Game of Thrones, The Man in the High Castle, Stranger Things and Westworld were nominated for a period-set series. The Affair, Better Call Saul, Bosch, Goliath, The Night Manager and Scandal are in contention in the contemporary series category. 
The complete list of nominees — representing features, TV and commercials — follows. Outstanding Locations in a Period TV Series 'The Crown' 
The Crown - Pat Karam, Robert Bentley/LMGI Game of Thrones - Matt Jones/LMGI, Naomi Liston/LMGI The Man in the High Castle - Nicole Noelle Chartrand, Robert Murdoch Stranger Things - Tony Holley/LMGI • Westworld - Mandi Dillin/LMGI Outstanding Locations in a Contemporary TV Series Ursula Coyote/Sony Pictures Television/AMC 
Better Call Saul, Season 2 - Christian Diaz de Bedoya Bosch - Robert Paulsen, Paul Schreiber/LMGI Goliath - Jason Kaplon/LMGI, Mike Barry/LMGI The Night Manager - Tom Howard, Daniel Sampedro Palerm Scandal - Veronique Vowell/LMGI
